text: The 2017 Orienteering World Cup was the 23rd edition of the Orienteering World Cup. The 2017 Orienteering World Cup consisted of 10 individual events, four relays and three sprint relay events. The events were located in Finland, Estonia, Latvia and Switzerland. The 2017 World Orienteering Championships in Tartu, Estonia are included in the World Cup. Matthias Kyburz of Switzerland won his second consecutive overall title in the men's World Cup, his fourth title in total. Tove Alexandersson of Sweden won her fourth consecutive overall title in the women's World Cup. ==Events== ===Men=== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 90%" |- !width="20"| !width="130"| Venue !width="140"| Distance !width="70"| Date !width="200"| Winner !width="200"| Second !width="200"| Third !width="20"| |- ! The winner is awarded 100 points. In WC events 1 to 8, the seven best results counts in the overall classification.
